repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: An account of Maturai Vīraṉ, a 17th century deity of protection. Written sometimes as individual lines of praise that end with ē vowel in order to rhyme, and sometimes in prose.

Comments: Manuscript incomplete, because no verses of exaltation to be found in the end. End also abrupt. The story is of the origin of maturai vīraṉ, a kāval teyvam. It also lists out the various deeds he performed to protect the people of Maturai. First few folios (up to 5r) consisting of invocatory content are by various hands.

support.p: Cover made of wood, bound by coir rope.

extent.measure: 5 initial folios + 1-56 + 2 guard folios, and several double-photos in the digitized version.

collation.desc: Text in order, but numbers are not.

supportDesc.foliation: No chapter separations or titles. Inconsistent numbering on left margin. Text divided into two columns, except for the beginning and the very end of the main text. Pagination is inconsistent.
Tamil numerals on recto left margin.
supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, with all margins in tact.

layoutDesc.layout: Sometimes, three columns may also occur. Inked (black).

handNote.desc: ō/ē sporadically differentiated from their short counterparts. 1r-5r change of scribe with each new folio scripto continua, ந and ன used interchangeably, ர and ற used interchangeably.

additions.desc: hariḥ ōm naṉṟāka benediction in the beginning, with somewhat damaged title of text.

binding.p: Bound by coir, rope (two holes) and wood cover.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

acquisition.p: Received August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 61.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
